build 在英语-中文（简体）词典中的翻译

build
verb
uk

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio
/bɪld/ us

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio
/bɪld/
built | built
A2 [ T or I ]
to make something by putting bricks or other materials together
建造，修建
They're building new houses by the river. 他们正在河边建新房子。
The birds built their nest in the tree. 鸟儿们在树上筑巢。
These old houses are built (= made) of stone. 这些老房子是用石头砌的。
Contractors have started building on waste land near the town. 承包商开始在离城镇不远的废弃土地上建房。
[ T ]
to create and develop something over a long period of time
建立；发展；开辟
We want to build a better future for our children. 我们想为孩子创造更美好的未来。
更多范例
  • We want to buy a plot of land to build a house.
  • There are plans to build a hotel on the most northerly point of the island.
  • We've had to build some cupboards to give us more storage space.
  • They're building a new bridge across the river.
  • He gathered some wood to build a fire.

习语

build bridges
Rome wasn't built in a day

短语动词

build around sth
build sth in/into sth
build on sth
build (sb/sth) up
build sth/sb up
build
noun [ C or U ]
uk

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio
/bɪld/ us

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio
/bɪld/
the size and shape of a person's body
身材，体形
She was of slim build with short, dark hair. 她身材苗条，一头黑色的短发。
(build在剑桥英语-中文（简体）词典的翻译 © Cambridge University Press)

build的例句

build
The above architectural specification captures a modular design of the system to be built as follows.
来自 Cambridge English Corpus
If the pump we have built stops working, shall we say it has a disease ?
来自 Cambridge English Corpus
The reason for this is simple: new relationships tend to be built upon concrete achievements.
来自 Cambridge English Corpus
The equations for the trace, even yanking, are built into the syntax of the nets.
来自 Cambridge English Corpus
The foundation of his success as a political patron is built in his philosophy of amala-gbegiri politics.
来自 Cambridge English Corpus
Sequents are then built from typed lists of relations.
来自 Cambridge English Corpus
In both their phrasing and their movement one feels the poem slowly and deliberately building up for the climax.
来自 Cambridge English Corpus
Indeed, they do not have divergence built into them, in the sense that they are (hereditarily) total.
来自 Cambridge English Corpus
示例中的观点不代表剑桥词典编辑、剑桥大学出版社和其许可证颁发者的观点。

“每日一词”

firework

a small container filled with explosive chemicals that produce bright coloured patterns or loud noises when they explode
